sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Gosper curve.
message_1: What is the total length of the Gosper curve after the 4th iteration, if the initial line segment has a length of 1 unit?
message_2:
The Gosper curve, also known as the Peano-Gosper curve or the flowsnake, is a fractal curve constructed using a set of substitution rules. After each iteration, the length of the curve increases by a factor of the square root of 7.

After the 4th iteration, the length of the Gosper curve will be:

Initial length * (sqrt(7))^4

Since the initial length is 1 unit, the total length after the 4th iteration will be:

(1) * (sqrt(7))^4 = (7)^2 = 49 units
